boardgame.name: Squad Leader
boardgame.description: A shot disturbs the eerie silence of a deserted city street, punctuated by the frantic footfalls of men seeking cover. One of Kruger_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s last veteran nco_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s lies motionless in the street. The remnants of the dead man_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s squad are nowhere to be seen_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;scattered in nearby houses and gutters_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;all thoughts the advance abandoned with the stunned demise or their leader...the compulsion for revenge obviously overcome by their instinct for self-preservation. Off to the right, Kruger_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s own men have located the source of the lethal shot and are laying down a steady stream of fire on the church steeple directly ahead. The absence of responding fire suggests that the lone Russian marksman has beat a hasty retreat of been victimized by the withering fire of the German retort. Kruger has seen enough. He is to occupy the church and set up a regimental observation post at once. His orders leave no leeway for delays by a single sniper. He gives the signal to rush the building. Obedient their training, his men, veterans of France, the Balkans, and 18 months of fighting in Russia, spring to their feet. Seconds later the sharp, staccato retort of a Russian machinegun concludes the assertiveness of death itself that this time Kruger was wrong..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This is Squad Leader...a game of WWII tactical combat in Europe. Now you make the instant decisions resulting in life or death for your men, victory or defeat for your army...for YOU are the Squad Leader. YOU direct the fire against your squad, select your plan of attack, or set your defenses against massed Russian human wave or armour assaults. Will that hedgerow provide adequate cover for your flanking efforts, or will your men be cut down by the American machinegun position in the woods? The decision is irrevocable and yours alone. You must live or die by the results._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Squad Leader utilizes programmed instruction to guide you through 12 scenarios of increasing realism and complexity. The scenarios run the gamut from street fighting in Stalingrad to armoured advances across snow covered roads in the Ardennes. A Campaign Game ties the individual scenarios together and allows you own personal leader counter to advance in rank and ability. In addition, a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;Design You Own_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; section is included so that players can create an unlimited number of play situations of their own creation._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each hex in Squad Leader represents 40 meters or real terrain with counters representing individual leaders, support weapons, and vehicles of 4 man crews and 12 man squads. Each game turn is divided into two player turns with 8 phases, equivalent to two minutes of actual time._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Squad Leader is more than just a game, it is a game system which can be used to portray any WWII infantry action. Its innovative system does for infantry combat what Panzerblitz and Panzer Leader have done for armoured warfare games. Squad Leader provides innovative rules for morale, leadership, machineguns, flamethrowers, demo charges, smoke, hidden placement, sewer movement, off-board artillery, radio contact, anti-tank guns, night actions, wire, entrenchments, mines, bunkers, rubble, multi-story building differentiation, fire, river crossings, roadblocks, mortars, and much more._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Be forewarned! Squad Leader is not an easy game. Do not attempt it without prior wargaming experience. Squad Leader is rated Tournament Level IV on the A.H. Complexity scale._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In each game you get:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 520 two-sided _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;frac12;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; die cut counters representing the men and weapons of the German, Russian, and American armies of WWII._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 192 two-sided ⅝_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; die cut counters representing fortifications and individual vehicles of the combatants._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Big 22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; x 28_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; four section, full-colour GEOMORPHIC mapboard which can be arranged to make literally hundreds of different terrain configurations that can represent large cities, small villages, wooded hillsides, or even the flat plains of the Ukraine. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Comprehensive, illustrated 36-page rules of play and designer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s notes booklet._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Scenario cards for the first 12 carefully construction game situations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Two highly refined Quick Reference Data Cards which reduce the complexities of a realistic infantry combat game into easily playable proportions. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

2003 Origins Awards Hall of Fame Inductee

punched and complete, box in vg condition

Game is complete and in excellent condition. This copy has the 4th edition rules. Pictures available upon request. I also have two other copies, both 2nd Edition. One 2nd edition box is shot, the other has a dirty box, but the box is pretty intact. I also have a Cross of Iron which got all mixed up with it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;s corresponding SL(my own copy from long ago), and is certainly missing some pieces, (either the COI or SL don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;t know which). I also currently cannot find the COI rules. If you are interested in either of these other copies, let me know, and I will search for the rules some more, as I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;m sure they are around somewhere. Obviously the second _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;set_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; is to be sold as a set, as it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;s jumbled together.

Part of a package deal, each the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;best_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; (final) edition of its release: 1) Squad Leader 4th Edition (more than complete copy, has about 3 or 4 copies of the game worth of counters neatly organized) 2) Cross of Iron 4th Edition: Complete, unpunched! 3) Crescendo of Doom (1st/only edition): Complete, unpunched! 4) G.I. Anvil of Victory: Complete, Unpunched! Also included are some extra scenarios found elsewhere. the total for all of this is $100+ $28 shipping withint he US (These are *very* heavy altogether, particularly with GI Anvil of Victory) The games are not available for individual purchase. The reason they are listed this way: Unfortuantely, BGG doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t allow more than one game to be listed as one package for sale, so each game is listed at its appromixate cost within the set. I listed them this way, ebcause last time I wrote down the price of a full set of a game and its expansions under only one game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s title, someone saw the price on the sales page, didn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t look at the description, and flamed me for wanting so much for just one game (even those it wasn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t just one game). The prices work out to: Squad Leader: $10 3 expansions, each one new/unpunched:$30 each While most items can be sent overseas, shipping for this package is within the US only, unless you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re willing to wait quite a while for finding out the exact shipping charges overseas.
2nd edition box, has all rules, counters, maps 1-4, and scenarios 1-12.

Squad Leader, Cross of Iron, Crescendo of Doom, GI: Anvil of Victory bundle. They have to be sold as a bundle due to the way the counters are bagged (see below). Counters: 1. I really don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t know if they_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re all there -- I added the counts from the backs of the boxes, and it turns out to be something like 4,500 counters for all 4 games. There_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s no way I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m going to count all those! :D 2. All the counters are in bags, sorted according to nationality, _not_ according to game. Here is the breakdown per bag: --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #1...CoD, GI: British --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #2...CoD, GI: German --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #3...SL - GI: Russian --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #4...GI: USA --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #5...SL: All (German, Russian, Minor) --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #6...CoD, GI: French and Minor --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Bag #7...SL - GI: Miscellaneous 3. The counters look to be in very good to excellent shape. I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t have the time to look at all of them, but what I can see looks good. Now, onto the individual games: Completeness: all the maps, quick reference cards, rules, and scenarios are present. The whole set comes with 3 dice (2 white, 1 red). SQUAD LEADER: Box: Dished, much edge-wear/shelfwear, corners intact Rules: Worn, marked, cover coming loose. Scenarios: Stapled, slightly dog-eared Quick reference cards (CRTs, etc.) : Good Maps (4 total): Flat, very good condition except that one map has a 1-1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; long split along the back edge at the seam, but the front side (map side) is still intact. CROSS OF IRON: Box: Flat. As in, flat like a pancake. There is one intact corner on the whole thing. Rules: Worn, marked, cover is loose. Scenarios: Stapled, good condition. Quick reference cards (CRTs, etc.) : Slight creases. Map (1): Flat, very good condition. CRESCENDO OF DOOM (overall, the newest looking of the bunch) : Box: Shelfwear, fading. All corners intact. Rules: Good condition, marked with errata. Scenarios: Stapled, good condition. Quick reference cards (CRTs, etc.) : Very good condition. Map (2): Flat, very good condition. GI: ANVIL OF VICTORY Box: Dished. One corner/edge is heavily worn. All corners intact. Rules: Worn. Scenarios: Stapled, good condition. Quick reference cards (CRTs, etc.) : Slightly worn around the edges. Map (5) : Flat, very good condition. Map Overlays: Good condition. If you want pictures of anything, let me know. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d be glad to get out the digital camera. Likewise, if I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve glossed over something you want to know, please ask. Shipping: Actual shipping charge. Please see my ebay feedback for _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;weadockfamily_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; if you have any concerns about my reliability.

Combined Squad Leader+Cross of Iron+Crescendo of Doom+GI anvil of victory set (see details below) £75 Squad Leader spare parts: COI Box £3 Squad Leader spare parts: Assorted Counters approx 600 mainly markers £3 Squad Leader spare parts: Map Overlays 2 sheets overlays A_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;O £4 Squad Leader spare parts: Mounted maps 1 £5 Squad Leader spare parts: Mounted maps 2 £5 Squad Leader spare parts: Mounted maps 3 £5 Squad Leader spare parts: Mounted maps 4 £5 Squad Leader spare parts: Mounted maps 5 £5 Squad Leader spare parts: Mounted maps 8 £5 Squad Leader spare parts: Rule COI £4 Squad Leader spare parts: Rule GIAOV £4 Squad Leader spare parts: Rule SL £4 Squad Leader spare parts: SL Box £4 Squad Leader spare parts: Unmounted map 1 £3 Squad Leader spare parts: Unmounted map 2 £3 Squad Leader spare parts: Unmounted map 3 £3 Squad Leader spare parts: Unmounted map 4 £3 Full details of the combined Squad Leader set Boxes: Boxes included for SL,COI,GIAOV all in reasonable condition, significant amount of storage wear and a number if corner have been fixed with clear tape but they are still perfectly serviceable Reference cards: 8 in total, although there is no clearly identification, I think that one pair from each game Rules: All four sets of rule some notes in them, generally good condition though the front sheet on GIAOV is loose Maps: Although these don’t follow in sequence you’ll have to take my word for it they are a full set for SL,COI and GIAOV Maps 1,2,3,4,5,8,12,13,14,15 (original COD maps are missing but good quality full colour laser copies are included [maps 5,6]).. All in very good condition with the exception of Map 4 that is starting to split on the fold (but still quite usable). Counters: SL is 100% complete COI is missing 26 5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters from 576 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 137 1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters from 520 COD is missing only one 5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters. GIAOV is missing 2 5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters from 528 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 309 1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters from 1040 Scenario cards: Full compliment of cards (2 are copies on same weight card) for scenarios 1-47 Overlays: – Full set A,B,C..O (A,K are copies on card) Dice – 2 standard Avalon Hill D6 Note: I’ve left in the scans of the counter sheets that I checked them against so you can see exactly what ones are missing. Weight approx 5kg for the lot

My never played 4th Edition Copy of Squad Leader. This is the latest edition with all the errata and the nicer textured brown backed mounted mapboards. All game components listed on the box are present. The scenario sheets are still unseparated. The countersheets were unpunched but a few rows have fallen out over the years so those pieces are in sepearate baggies (not pictured). Not that it should really matter but you can tell the game has never been played because the only punched american or russian counters are the russian _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; that fell out no troops. One German Leader (the almost never used lowely 8-0) somehow got swapped with my played copy of the game I sold over a decade ago. So it IS included but is a lot more worn than the otherwise crisp components. The box itself has no split corners and is pretty tight. There is shelfwear on all sides. I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t consider it too bad at all for its age but opinions always very on that. Can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t imagine much nicer of a copy of 4th Edition Squad Leader unless it was kept in shrink or otherwise packed away since purchase.

Third edition of the rules booklet. The game boards are in excellent shape, the book is in good shape with just a little bit of grime on the first page (not enough to obscure any text). The scenario cards and reference cards are still bound together and not separated. The box is intact but shows shelf wear including scuffed edges but is not blown out. I have no idea if all the chits are there. There are far too many to count, but since I stopped playing this I really don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t believe much if any could possibly be missing.

Squad Leader 1977 Edition, The parts are: Game box, fair shape, top part has bottom two corners splilt, 36 page instruction booklet (second edition), shows age, no writing in it, six cardboard sheets with two scenarios, hafe of Germans and USSR, and, the others deal with US troops, intact, no writing on it, does show use, two cardboard sheets of reference data, shows age, no writing on it, battle cardboard board, comes in four parts, quite good shape, no writing on it, cardboard square tokens, about 700, they are: German (about 171), USSR (about 151), USA troops (about 140), leaders, L-M-H mgs. (no light USA), radios, flamethrowers, mortars, balanglore torpodoes, explosive charges, ? counters, German 50mm _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 75mm guns, USSR 57mm _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 76mm guns, USA 57mm _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 76mm _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 105mm guns, All vehicles (about 80): Germany Panzer Mark IV 75mm cannon three, Stugg III 75 six _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 105mm gun two, SdKfz 251 APC twelve, Truck seven,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;, Brummbar two, USSR T-34 76mm gun six , SU 122 two _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 152 one, M-3 APC five, Truck four, USA Sherman 75 five _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 105mm gun two, Hellcat T.D.two _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 105 cannon _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Priest_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; two, M-3 APC nine _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; M-16 one, Truck five, Jeep two, smoke/barbed wire counters, entrench, artillery request, FFE, bunker types, houses/2nd.floor/house on fire tiles, prep fire tiles, no dice!
